data.title: Members - The Trapani Lab at Amherst College
data.snippet:
#### Ha Dong '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Former Lab Research Student  
 Ha is a senior from Hanoi, Vietnam, tri-majoring in Physics, Mathematics, and Neuroscience. Ha is interested in how different sensory modalities shape behaviors and plans to pursue a Ph.D. degree. Outside the lab, Ha works with the Center for Teaching and Learning and the Strategic Learning Center to help improve the teaching and learning on campus. In his free time, you would find him taking photographs or biking along the Norwottuck Rail Trail, trying out new coffee recipes, or jamming with friends with his cajon. Learn more about him here: 

#### Shirley Fu '26 [...] #### Allie Platt '26

'26 Neuroscience Thesis Student  
 Allie Platt (she/her) is a senior from Brooklyn, New York. She is majoring in neuroscience on the pre-med track. Outside the lab, she is co-founder and co-president of the figure skating club, an EMT on ACEMS, and a Peer Educator. In her free time, she loves to listen to music (tune in to Hyperfixstation on WAMH), explore a new coffee shop, and travel.

#### Ha Dong '26 [...] Dagim (he/him) is a senior from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia majoring in Neuroscience and Computer Science. He is interested in pursuing Computational Neuroscience specifically neural interface research as a career. He started doing scientific research as a summer undergraduate research fellow in the summer of 2020 in the Edwards lab at Amherst College and fell in love with it. In the summer of 2021, he worked in the JazLab at MIT and the Center for Brains, Minds and Machines on modeling the human brain using Machine Learning. Outside of school work, Dagim is involved in dance groups (ACSU and DASAC) on campus, photography for the yearbook (OLIO) and works as student assistant for AI in the liberal arts. He also enjoys football (soccer as Americans would call it), gaming, and being very bad at

data.title: About Us | Strategic Learning Center - Amherst College
data.snippet:
## SLC Contributors

Thank you for your significant contributions to the Strategic Learning Center during its inception.

 Amhed Aly ’24
 Isabel Hardy ’24
 Ha Dong ’26
 Prakhar Agrawal ’27
 Tim Carroll ’25
 Sam Fetters ’26
 Muntaha Mamun ’25 [...] Hi, my name is Temidayo. I’m a junior majoring in Neuroscience with a growing interest in computer science. My time at Amherst has been all about exploration. Whether it’s playing the saxophone, dabbling in darkroom photography, or even experimenting with metalwork, I love discovering new passions. Outside of class, I work with a nonprofit, A Better Chance (ABC), that supports Amherst High School students as they navigate the college application process. I’m deeply motivated to give back because of the incredible network of support that has helped me along my own journey.  As a Peer Academic Coach, I believe in holistic reflection—both in and outside of the classroom—and I’m committed to providing helpful insights, resourceful tools, or simply being an open and supportive listener. I’m [...] adventures with her family, hiking, kayaking, and reading and writing about social justice issues.
